summary:
Committed development professional with 20 years of experience working in the area of development cooperation, agriculture, livestock production and animal health, gender, food security & public health.

Skilled in planning, coordinating and implementing development (research) projects as well as training and management of research teams.  

My skill set includes mixed method research, project management, monitoring & evaluation, and capacity building. Please visit my website https://www.egrid.nl for more information.

I am available for short-term as well as long-term assignments.

Mid Term review', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Ellen Geerlings Research & International Development Consultancy Services', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Ellen Geerlings Research & International Development Consultancy Services', 'description': 'https://www.egrid.nl', 'title': 'Independent Consultant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1062418, 'name': 'GFA Consulting Group GmbH', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGHmM9N9fYgBg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519868385461?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=O6Eka4sqnD46c5Fm8mHf92-ibrLxm0sq0H_9HwzTOQE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/gfa-consulting-group-gmbh/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Home-based', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'GFA Consulting Group GmbH', 'description': 'Gender and inclusion expert for the Forest Landscape Restoration (FLR) project in five provinces (Takhar, Badakhshan, Samangan, Khost and Paktia) of Afghanistan. The project is commissioned by The German Federal Ministry of Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) and managed by the The German Agency for International Cooperation (GIZ) in collaboration with GFA Consulting Group.
My responsibility is to support the implementing organizations in Afghanistan in mainstreaming gender into their project activities. As on-site support is currently not possible due to COVID-19, I have developed an interactive e-learning course on gender and inclusion in natural resource management. The e-learning consists of several webinars and e-learning through a variety of tools including story telling, quizzes, podcasts and case studies. Topics include diversity and inclusion, gender labour division in forest landscape use and access and control over natural resources, gender-disaggregated data collection and analysis, and gender sensitive approaches in reforestation activities.', 'title': 'Consultant gender and inclusion for the Forest Landscape Restoration Project in Afghanistan', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': 50736, 'name': 'ZOA', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFKB9scbOf3sg/company-logo_400_400/0/1576506983056?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=OMtAts6K9_qnn-eMA2JVNMC7NV9JWbofB2S92Vqx-bg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/zoa/', 'employees': {'start': 501, 'end': 1000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Apeldoorn, Gelderland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'ZOA', 'description': 'We are able! strengthens Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) and Disabled People Organizations (DPOs) in six fragile and conflict affected countries (Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), South Sudan, Sudan, Uganda and Ethiopia) in their lobby and advocacy for sustainable and inclusive access to basic resources, contributing to improved food security (SDG2).

The baseline study will be the basis for the measurement of progress on a number of fixed result indicators. These indicators will consist of the basket indicators as determined by the donor, The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, complemented with a limited set of project specific indicators for each country. 
My overall role is to coordinate and oversee data collection processes in the six programme countries. More specifically my responsibilities include:
- Ensuring a certain level of objectivity/neutrality in data collection in-country.
- Ensuring that data are collected in such a way that the results can be aggregated at an overall consortium level. This entails developing a data collection infrastructure, making an inventory of available tools to collect the data that are needed to determine baseline indicator values and targets.
- Determining adequate sampling methodology and sample size in collaboration with the country teams.
- Assist country teams with tool-development or provide support with the adaptation of existing tools.
- Provide guidance and assist country teams with analysis of raw data, in such a way that the results can be aggregated at an overall consortium level.
- Write an overall baseline report based on the results that are provided by the country teams.', 'title': 'Consultant We Are Able! baseline study', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock, Kabul, Afghanistan', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock, Kabul, Afghanistan', 'description': "International consultant in charge of the mid-term evaluation of the 'Support to National Priority Program' (SNaPP2) in Afghanistan. The overall goal of SNaPP2 is to contribute to improving food security and economic status of poor rural households in Balkh, Herat & Ningahar provinces. It has two major components: 1) Institutional development and capacity building of community organizations, public extension services and relevant private sector entities, and 2) sustained increased incomes of small farmers and herders fostered by improvements in productivity and output, infrastructure and market linkages.
